name: Grilled Hoisin Beef
author: Chef John
summary: The (underrated) hoisin sauce is a thickened, fermented soy-sauce-like substance, flavored with chilies, garlic, vinegar, sugar, and, of course, exotic spices. It makes a great marinade. And unless you horribly overcook it, this skirt steak is juicy and tender.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
1  green onion, light parts only, minced
directions: Whisk hoisin sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, hot sauce, sesame oil, grated ginger, garlic, brown sugar, salt, and pepper together in a large mixing bowl
Cut skirt steak crosswise into about 4 or 5 smaller pieces
Transfer steak into marinade and toss until all pieces are evenly coated
Refrigerate; marinate at least 2 hours and up to 12 hours
Line a baking pan with paper towels
Transfer pieces of steak to the paper towels and mop off some of the marinade
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate
Cook to medium rare or medium, 4 to 5 minutes per side
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read between 130 and 135 degrees F (about 54 degrees C)
Transfer steak to a warm plate
Let rest for a few minutes
Transfer steak to a warm serving platter and pour any accumulated juices over skirt steak
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and sliced green onions
